Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the discovery of a Nazi submarine in the Great Lakes, as there is no evidence to support such a finding.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or legitimate news articles to back up the assertion of a recent discovery of a Nazi submarine in the Great Lakes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the ship discovered at the bottom of Lake Ontario is a German submarine, without any factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: The Coast Guard provides an alternative explanation, stating that while there is a sunken WWII submarine in the Great Lakes, it is not a German submarine and was not recently discovered.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the ship discovered in Lake Ontario is not a Nazi submarine, as confirmed by the Coast Guard.
Falters at times: The claim falters by using a photo of an unrelated Russian submarine from the Cold War era to support the false story.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
